items.notes: MYB elements are crucial for transcriptional regulation of EgCAD2
MYB elements are crucial for transcriptional regulation of EgCCR
BSa and BSb sites are protected in exponentially-growing cells
MYB sites interact with EgMYB2 in vitro
MYB sites interact with EgMYB2 in vitro

citations.quote: MYB elements are crucial for transcriptional regulation of EgCAD2 and EgCCR.

The conserved MYB elements in EgCAD2 and EgCCR promoters are crucial both for the formation of DNA-protein complexes in EMSA experiments and for the transcriptional activation of EgCAD2 and EgCCR promoters in vascular tissues in planta.
The MYB sites are perfectly conserved across Eucalyptus species, arguing for their possible functional importance.

items.perturbation_effect: expression in cambium and secondary xylem
expression in cambium and secondary xylem

citations.quote: The conserved MYB elements in EgCAD2 and EgCCR promoters are crucial both for the formation of DNA-protein complexes in EMSA experiments and for the transcriptional activation of EgCAD2 and EgCCR promoters in vascular tissues in planta.

The MYB elements in the EgCCR and EgCAD2 promoters are crucial not only for the formation of protein-DNA complexes in vitro either with recombinant MYB protein or with cellular protein extracts, but also for the transcriptional regulation of EgCCR and EgCAD2 genes in planta.

items.evidence_type: in vivo footprinting, EMSA, transactivation experiments
in vivo footprinting, EMSA, transactivation experiments

citations.quote: The conserved MYB elements in EgCAD2 and EgCCR promoters are crucial both for the formation of DNA-protein complexes in EMSA experiments and for the transcriptional activation of EgCAD2 and EgCCR promoters in vascular tissues in planta.
We identified an 80 bp regulatory region in the Eucalyptus gunnii EgCAD2 promoter that contains two MYB elements, each arranged in a distinct module with newly identified cis-elements.
The MYB elements in the EgCAD2 and EgCCR promoters are crucial for the transcriptional regulation of these genes in planta.

items.limitation_or_gap: Previous study used only VND promoter sequences for GUS reporter gene assay, which may not contain all the cis-elements required for vessel-specific expression.
items.proposed_future_work: Using whole VND gene sequences for GUS reporter gene assay to ensure vessel-specific expression.

items.limitation_or_gap: Previous study did not observe ectopic deposition of secondary walls in VND overexpressors.
items.proposed_future_work: Further investigation of VND functions in regulating secondary wall biosynthesis.

items.limitation_or_gap: Limited understanding of the transcriptional regulation of secondary wall biosynthesis.
items.proposed_future_work: Further study of the transcriptional network involving NAC and MYB transcription factors.

citations.quote: VND1 to VND5 possess functions similar to that of the SND1 secondary wall NAC and are transcriptional regulators of secondary wall biosynthesis in vessels.
The transcriptional regulation of secondary wall biosynthesis involves a multi-leveled feed-forward loop regulatory structure.

citations.quote: VND1 to VND5 possess functions similar to that of the SND1 secondary wall NAC and are transcriptional regulators of secondary wall biosynthesis in vessels.
The transcriptional regulation of secondary wall biosynthesis involves a multi-leveled feed-forward loop regulatory structure.
VND1 to VND5 are specifically expressed in vessels, an expression pattern similar to that of VND6 and VND7.

citations.quote: Most of the wood-associated transcription factors have not yet been subjected to functional characterization due to the difficulty of genetic studies of gene functions in tree species.
The lignin-related MYB transcription factors in Arabidopsis have been studied well, but most of the wood-associated transcription factors have not yet been subjected to functional characterization.
The biosynthetic pathway of monolignols is involved in the general phenylpropanoid pathway, but the regulation of this pathway is not well understood.
The lignin polymer is mainly deposited in the tracheary elements and fibers, but its deposition in other cell types or tissues is not well understood.

items.notes: NAC/VND/SND transcription factors regulate MYB46/83
MYB46/83 transcription factors regulate enzymes in lignin biosynthesis
PtoMYB216 transcription factor regulates lignin biosynthesis
PtoMYB216 transcription factor activates upstream genes in lignin biosynthesis
PtoMYB216 transcription factor regulates ectopic deposition of lignin

citations.quote: Recent studies have demonstrated that formation of secondary wall requires a coordinated transcriptional activation of the genes involved in the lignin biosynthesis [1], [13].
Many transcription factors, belonging to NAC, MYB, and WRKY gene families, have been shown to regulate lignin biosynthetic pathway in various plant species [14], [15].
PtoMYB216 encodes a protein belonging to the R2R3-MYB family and displays significant similarity with other MYB factors shown to regulate lignin synthesis in Arabidopsis.

citations.quote: In plants, phenylpropanoid compounds are a wide range of secondary metabolites including monolignols, flavonoids, stilbenes and various phenolic acids.
Several NAC (for NAM, ATAF1/2, and CUC2) transcription factors including NST1/2, NST3/SND1, VND6/7 act as master switches that activate secondary wall biosynthesis in Arabidopsis.
PtoMYB156 may repress phenylpropanoid biosynthesis and negatively regulate secondary cell wall formation in poplar.

citations.quote: A hierarchical network of transcription factors has been proposed to control secondary wall formation in plants.

Several NAC (for NAM, ATAF1/2, and CUC2) transcription factors including NST1/2, NST3/SND1, VND6/7 act as master switches that activate secondary wall biosynthesis in Arabidopsis (Arabidopsis thaliana)51011.

PtrMYB2, PtrMYB3, PtrMYB20 and PtrMYB21 have been demonstrated to be direct targets of PtrWNDs and functional orthologs of the Arabidopsis MYB46 and MYB83 which act as second-level master switches controlling secondary wall biosynthesis41415.
